arm_group.description: treatment of degenerative disc disease using the PROW LIF

brief_summary.textblock:
This is a prospective, single-arm, open-label, non-randomized study. The aim of the study is
      to assess the safety and efficacy of the Prow LIF procedure in Transforaminal Lumbar
      Interbody Fusion (TLIF) procedures for the treatment of subjects with symptomatic
      degenerative disc disease (DDD).

clinical_study.brief_title: Prospective Study To Assess The Safety and Efficacy of the PROW LIF Procedure

detailed_description.textblock:
Primary endpoints:

        -  Safety: Incidence of device-related anticipated and unanticipated serious adverse
           events (SAE). However, ALL complications and adverse events (AE) will be monitored and
           recorded.

        -  Primary radiographic effectiveness outcome parameter: evaluations of fusion rate.

intervention.description: TLIF procedure for the treatment of degenerative disc disease using the PROW LIF procedure (system)
intervention.intervention_name: treatment of degenerative disc disease using the PROW LIF

facility.name: Spine Surgery Department, Meir Hospital, Israel

clinical_study.official_title: Prospective Study To Assess The Safety and Efficacy of the PROW LIF Procedure

overall_official.affiliation: Head of the Spine surgery department, Meir Hospital

primary_outcome.description: Primary radiographic effectiveness outcome parameter: evaluations of fusion. Fusion will be evaluated at 6 months, 12 months and 24 months post-op using plain radiographs (AP, lateral and flexion/extension films) and at 24 months using CT scan as well

required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on June 04, 2014
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.study_design: Endpoint Classification: Safety/Efficacy Study, Intervention Model: Single Group Assignment, Masking: Open Label, Primary Purpose: Treatment
